data.name: Bresenham Line Drawing
data.description:
## Bresenham Line Algorithm

### Task

Code function `line` with bresenham algorithm without using any `floats`, `*`, `/`, `%`.

`Algorithm using only integer arithmetic` can be found on the [wikipedia page](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bresenham%27s_line_algorithm#Algorithm_for_integer_arithmetic).

Function `line` accepts 6 parameters: 

The first four parameters ```x0, y0, x1, y1```, are coordinates of two endpoints for the line to draw on ``screen`` using ``color``. 

``screen`` is a 2d array of char (or string length 1) for example ``screen(13, 7, '⬜')`` generate:

```
[
["⬜", "⬜", "⬜", "⬜", "⬜", "⬜", "⬜", "⬜", "⬜", "⬜", "⬜", "⬜", "⬜"],
["⬜", "⬜", "⬜", "⬜", "⬜", "⬜", "⬜", "⬜", "⬜", "⬜", "⬜", "⬜", "⬜"],
["⬜", "⬜", "⬜", "⬜", "⬜", "⬜", "⬜", "⬜", "⬜", "⬜", "⬜", "⬜", "⬜"],
["⬜", "⬜", "⬜", "⬜", "⬜", "⬜", "⬜", "⬜", "⬜", "⬜", "⬜", "⬜", "⬜"],
["⬜", "⬜", "⬜", "⬜", "⬜", "⬜", "⬜", "⬜", "⬜", "⬜", "⬜", "⬜", "⬜"],
["⬜", "⬜", "⬜", "⬜", "⬜", "⬜", "⬜", "⬜", "⬜", "⬜", "⬜", "⬜", "⬜"],
["⬜", "⬜", "⬜", "⬜", "⬜", "⬜", "⬜", "⬜", "⬜", "⬜", "⬜", "⬜", "⬜"],
]
```

``color`` is the char to use to plot pixels of the line on the screen. 

### Example :

``line(1, 1, 11, 5, screen(13, 7, '⬜'), '⬛')``

shoud return :

```
[
["⬜", "⬜", "⬜", "⬜", "⬜", "⬜", "⬜", "⬜", "⬜", "⬜", "⬜", "⬜", "⬜"],
["⬜", "⬛", "⬛", "⬜", "⬜", "⬜", "⬜", "⬜", "⬜", "⬜", "⬜", "⬜", "⬜"],
["⬜", "⬜", "⬜", "⬛", "⬛", "⬜", "⬜", "⬜", "⬜", "⬜", "⬜", "⬜", "⬜"],
["⬜", "⬜", "⬜", "⬜", "⬜", "⬛", "⬛", "⬛", "⬜", "⬜", "⬜", "⬜", "⬜"],
["⬜", "⬜", "⬜", "⬜", "⬜", "⬜", "⬜", "⬜", "⬛", "⬛", "⬜", "⬜", "⬜"],
["⬜", "⬜", "⬜", "⬜", "⬜", "⬜", "⬜", "⬜", "⬜", "⬜", "⬛", "⬛", "⬜"],
["⬜", "⬜", "⬜", "⬜", "⬜", "⬜", "⬜", "⬜", "⬜", "⬜", "⬜", "⬜", "⬜"],
]
```

You need to plot pixels of the line in the screen array and returning it.

Please note:

1. origin of screen is top / left (screen[0][0])
2. new screen must be returned
3. color will always be ``⬛`` and background will be ``⬜``
4. screen could already have some pixels drawn (multiline and random tests)
5. all lines will be drawn entirely on screen (no clipping needed)
6. screen function is a helper to generate a screen 2d array width x height pixels using a char as background color
7. lines must be drawn in correct order from x0,y0 to x1,y1
8. `floats`, `*`, `/`, `%` are not allowed in this kata. Bit shifting is.
9. in tests expected screen is in green and actual wrong is in red. Screen is white when it's ok.
